diff_hunk:
@@ -1960,11 +1960,7 @@ def pairwise_distance(x1, x2, p=2, eps=1e-6):
         >>> output = F.pairwise_distance(input1, input2, p=2)
         >>> output.backward()
     """
-    assert x1.size() == x2.size(), "Input sizes must be equal."
-    assert x1.dim() == 2, "Input must be a 2D matrix."
-    diff = torch.abs(x1 - x2)
-    out = torch.pow(diff + eps, p).sum(dim=1, keepdim=True)
body:
Pairwise distance takes the distance for each element to each element in another set (NxM) (http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.metrics.pairwise.pairwise_distances.html).
This function calculates one distance between two vectors (N).

Since it's a relatively fresh PR I'm asking here: @li-roy can we have some clarification?
